answers.answer: I had asked my doctor about getting pregnant with thyroid meds.  I am suppressed to less than .01 purposefully.  She told me that she would decrease my meds and let my TSH get higher for a few months at a time if I wanted to conceive again.  She said that with my low TSH levels, it would be very hard to conceive and if I did likely for a miscarraige.  I haven't tried yet, but I thought maybe this would be helpful info.

Hi, i have hyper thyroid problem one year after my first baby. is been over 2 years now. my doctor told me is not safe to get pregnant while having thyroid problem. is all of your doctor telling you the same?
what happened pl let me know..***@****

This is a very old thread and the previous posters are no longer active on the forum.Unfortunately, they were only going by TSH, which is often suppressed for various reasons.  Additionally, TSH fluctuates greatly over the course of a day, so it's a very unreliable diagnostic.You should get your actual thyroid hormone levels tested.  Those are Free T3 and Free T4.  Adequate levels of thyroid hormones are essential for the growth and development of a fetus.  TSH is not a thyroid hormone and does not adequately reflect actual thyroid hormone levels under many/most circumstances.

question: Back in July my TSH was 7.3.  At the time I was on 25 mcg.  My dr increased my dose to 100 mcg.  A month and half later my TSH dropped to 0.25.  He told me to keep the same dose, but skip one day a week.  I just had it rechecked (about 6 weeks of skipping one day a week).  Now the TSH is 0.01.  So, I feel I'm obviously on to much med.  He told me to now skip two days a week.  Is that really going to make a difference?  Can TSH levels go negative?  I am also trying to get pregnant.  Is it safe for me to get pregnant.  I'm very frustrated w/ that because I've been keeping my blood sugar good for a year now.  And then when I wanted to start trying in March, this whole thyroid thing came up.  I got pregnant in June, but lost the baby at 6.5 weeks.  I really want to concieve/give birth to a baby.  My fear is that because I have diabetes and thyroid disorder and a previous miscarriage, I will not be able to.  Has anyone gone through this?
title: Too Much Thyroid Med/Trying to get pregnant
